subject: history
title: Development of Modern Education System
description: British education policies; Wood's Despatch; Hunter Commission; Universities

details.decision: English as medium of instruction (over Sanskrit/Arabic)
details.rationale: Create 'class of Indians' loyal to British; clerks for administration
details.quote: 'Indian in blood & colour, but English in taste, opinions, morals and intellect'
details.exam: **MOST ASKED**: Macaulay = English education; Downward Filtration Theory

details.exam:
**'Magna Carta of English Education'**

First systematic education policy

3 universities (1857)

details.founded: Calcutta, Bombay, Madras universities (1857) - on London University model

details.recommendation: Provincial control; vernacular medium for primary; women's education

details.universities-act: Indian Universities Act (1904): Govt control over universities; reduced elected members
details.reaction: Strongly opposed by nationalists; seen as curbing intellectual freedom

assessment.positive: Created educated middle class; English created pan-India communication; Modern scientific knowledge
assessment.negative: Neglected masses; vernacular ignored; Created clerks not leaders; Elite-centric; Traditional education destroyed
assessment.nationalist: National education movement (Tilak, Gandhi) created alternative schools rejecting British system

examTips.critical: **Wood's Despatch (1854)** = Magna Carta of English Education; **Macaulay (1835)** = English medium; **Hunter (1882)** = Primary education focus; **Universities (1857)** = Calcutta, Bombay, Madras
